1.title: Fear
1.plot: Max Blumenthal investigates the "grassroots movement" that is the FOX News sponsored Tea Party.

2.title: War
2.plot: Nir Rosen investigates America's reconstruction strategy in Afghanistan.

3.title: Greed
3.plot: Charlie LeDuff moves back to Detroit to work for the Detroit News. Now the paper's bankrupt and Detroit is being swarmed daily as the epicenter of America's economic collapse. In reaction, he takes the Detroit experience and turns it inside out.

4.title: Disaster
4.plot: Andrew Berends and a host of other journalists (Dan Rather, Daniel Morel, Ivan Watson) head to Haiti to cover the earthquake.

1.title: News Fixations and Taboos
1.plot: News program. Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with Tucker Carlson. A revealing look at news taboos - the issues the media have difficulty coming clean on and the ones they just can't stop talking about.

2.title: The Frontlines of Journalism
2.plot: News program. Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with Valerie Plame-Wilson. An exploration of how journalists function during a time of war.

3.title: Dumbing It Down
3.plot: News program. Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with Dan Rather. This episode examines the devolution of the news media into a commodity which appeals to our basest instincts.

4.title: Unreliable Sources
4.plot: News program. Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with The Yes Men. Looks at the people and outlets that provide us the news, and asks: Who are they? Why should we trust them?

5.title: The Anatomy of a Story
5.plot: News program. Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with documentary filmmaker Alex Gibney. This episode looks at how Journalists twist and turn their stories into tales of interest.

6.title: The Future of News
6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: American Worldview
1.plot: News program; Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with Rome Hartman. This episode takes a look at the conflict in Georgia. Also, why Americans can't easily get the Al Jazeera television news channel.

2.title: Crossing the Line
2.plot: News program; Gideon Yago hosts. Features interview with Randy Cohen, writer of "The Ethicist" column in The Sunday Times Magazine. This episode also explores the ethics of news magazine shows.

3.title: Agendas
3.plot: News program; Gideon Yago hosts. Gideon looks at the debate over clean coal and how it is dominated by two competing PR campaigns that obscure the real questions of issue.

4.title: Economics and News
4.plot: News program; Gideon Yago hosts. Gideon questions how news can survive in today's economy and how economic coverage both failed and succeeded in the lead up to the present state of affairs.

5.title: Government and the Media
5.plot: News program; Gideon Yago hosts. Yago covers issues surrounding the Fairness Doctrine; Obama and the press.

imdb.plot outline: In the third season, journalism's gone rogue. The critically acclaimed series returns, this time sending four award-winning journalists -- Max Blumenthal, Nir Rosen, Charlie LeDuff and Andrew Berends -- behind the mainstream media's bombastic headlines and empty rhetoric to expose the real stories that lurk beneath the surface of America's fragile culture. The IFC Media Project Presents . . . FEAR, WAR, GREED and DISASTER -- four rollicking 30-minute documentaries that go where blow-dried news personalities fear to tread. In "Fear", Max Blumenthal goes inside the Tea Party to find out who's really pulling the strings. Nir Rosen travels to Afghanistan in "War" to uncover what happened to the $51 Billion the USA has spent on "reconstruction." With Wall Street posting record profits and the rest of the country still screwed, Charlie LeDuff travels from Detroit to Manhattan to the nation's capital in search of answers. And in "Disaster", we follow Andrew Berends and a host of other reporters (including Ivan Watson, Daniel Morel and Dan Rather) as they struggle to cover the aftermath of Haiti's devastating earthquake.
